intro: Dicrobotryum divaricatum, commonly known as the zigzag rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Juncaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems that often exhibit a zigzag or undulating pattern, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish or brownish flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Dicrobotryum divaricatum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
